intro: Synostemon paucifolius, commonly known as the few-leaved synostemon, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and produces small, yellow flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often clustered at the base of the plant. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for xeriscaping in arid regions.
